document.title: Proposed Academic Standards for World Languages

5112E15BEA0B42E6A09B1FCC5F5D83AA.description:
Research, select and use materials relating to classical language and culture to be used for career planning, personal enrichment and enjoyment.
  • Communication via the Internet with other students of Latin or Greek around the world
  • National Latin Exam

0EFABACD4AE34E47A80E059DB127287B.description: Assess available opportunities at the national or global level to continue involvement with classical language and culture for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

474EB8D14EBF4F4494AB2A2F95EA0DB5.description:
Research career opportunities and enrichment activities related to classical language and culture.
  • Plays with classical themes
  • Professions dealing with classical culture in their work

D9832E4ED9074109B922E1F253DA8FA2.description: Assess available opportunities in the local community to continue involvement with classical language and culture for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

C16BE0CA7F9C401E8896AD5E57443144.description:
Explain national or global employment areas in which knowledge of classical language and culture may be used.
  • Law
  • Medicine, pharmacology
  • Museum curator, historian
  • Educator, writer

8DAA941FCA0E4EDA932646544DAE7CBF.description: Know national employment opportunities where knowledge of classical language and culture may be useful and why such knowledge is necessary.

8DDA56FCEAF046F78868D731D48A594E.description:
Identify local employment areas in which knowledge of classical language and culture may be used; interact with their employees.
  • Community members who are involved in a variety of careers
  • Discussion of legal and medical terms based in Greek and Latin.

AA69ACD3E1A44F25B27584F6E6A63604.description: Identify employment areas in the local community where knowledge of classical language and culture may be useful and how and why such knowledge is necessary.

8188C1FE8C164841A3D43218FF50C867.description:
Use resources available nationally and globally for studying classical culture.
  • Internet sites devoted to Latin, Greek, and classical culture
  • News about discoveries in classical archaeology
  • Classical themes in contemporary films and books

5C16F7EFD73148EE94A481B16C82D43D.description: Identify national or global resources for gathering information about Greco-Roman culture for practical purposes and personal enjoyment.

EB2FE07626F14508AE05D11200E1C9F4.description:
Use knowledge of classical language and culture to communicate interactively for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment of the resources in the local community.
  • Classical art collections in museums
  • Roman or Greek banquet
  • Skits (e.g., the assassination of Caesar, the last days of Socrates)
  • Music in Latin
  • Latin Forensic competitions

4FFDC9758EEC4D8C8D2B28A039D7A1F8.description: Identify local resources for gathering information about Greco-Roman culture for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment.

F7B0809B21354302AE609BB353FD42FB.description:
Discuss the reasons for studying Latin or Greek in a national and global perspective.
  • Knowledge of basis of Western culture
  • Latin as the basis for Romance languages (e.g., Spanish, Italian, French)
  • Latin as the basis of two-thirds of English vocabulary
  • Latin and Greek as basis for modern technical vocabularies

8E8F5864AD4944A9AD8AD66C2E71EE53.description: Know why classical learning is useful in the national and global community.

B779CBF57C6846D6B4D645E6D8A7C691.description:
Present and exchange information about classical language experience to others in the school and the community.
  • Classical festivals and competitions (e.g., Latin Day)
  • Organizations (e.g., school classics club activities, Junior Classical Leagues)
  • Video productions about Roman or Greek customs

D698361C9AFE455FB36917EDF3299C51.description: Know where in the local and regional community knowledge of classical language and culture is useful.

B39804F3E8884DF28D26068B8D7A16DA.description: Classical World Languages in the Community

F7B99D4E018049D896EDDEA0BBCBE47B.description:
Use speaking, writing and reading to compare and connect available opportunities in the local, national and global English speaking communities with the target language opportunities to continue involvement for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.
  • Movies and videos
  • Dramas and sports
  • Museums and archives
  • Social Service agencies

E6CC6BEDE732400AA916E1FC59258569.description: Assess comparisons and connections of available opportunities in the local, national and global English-speaking communities to continue involvement with the target language for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

C4CD691AD8D94F269693A180399538AA.description:
Research, select and use global authentic materials for career planning, personal enrichment and enjoyment.
  • Exploration of personal employment opportunities
  • Global ethnic celebrations, traditions and cultural events

11DE971B819A47F1AE6F5D663B5E864F.description: Assess available opportunities at the global level to continue involvement with the target culture for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

8540E1829C554BD58EE74C60A968C7FF.description:
Research, select and use national authentic materials for career planning, personal enrichment and enjoyment.
  • Exploration of personal employment opportunities
  • National ethnic celebrations, traditions and cultural events

795D8AFC591E46719C51406B287D3950.description: Assess available opportunities at the national level to continue involvement with the target culture for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

45EED3C9590E48539572CEDCB9122192.description:
Research, select and use local authentic materials to determine career opportunities, enrichment activities and personal enjoyment.
  • Exploration of personal employment opportunities
  • Personal involvement in local ethnic celebrations and traditions

10F5586FF63E487EA1DDF4931565ECD4.description: Assess available opportunities in the local community to continue involvement with the target culture for lifelong learning and personal enjoyment.

D6709B7536E144BA9FD2B26402B3A925.description:
Use speaking, writing and reading to compare and connect local, national and global employment opportunities for those who speak English and those who speak English and a target language.
  • Newspapers
  • Employment agencies
  • Unemployment office
  • College placement offices

0A3A86862DDF4F7CBA0DDF546387BC75.description: Explain comparisons and connections for employment opportunities that can be made in the local, national and global English-speaking communities with those who speak a target language.

EC9FEE1CB54F44FA8ADE8E4C80FBD215.description:
Name global employment areas in which world language skills may be used. Use target language to interact at the necessary language proficiency level with global community members in their occupations.
  • Occupation and profession names
  • Career and personal options

07FE54AA8A674D7D868C5474AB3AD642.description: Know global employment opportunities where the target language is used and how and why the target language is necessary.

0B225E3F0E4A43B18CB8049F37905069.description:
Name national employment areas in which world language skills may be used. Use target language at the necessary language proficiency level to interact with national community members in their occupations.
  • Occupation and profession names
  • Career and personal options

717D0EEEF78F4722A7421E197DAF889D.description: Know national employment opportunities where the target language is used and how and why the target language is necessary.

6BA872B7BD734837851761B819FC136E.description:
Name local employment areas in which language skills may be used. Use the language at the necessary language proficiency level to interact with local community members in their occupations.
  • Occupation and profession names
  • Career and personal options

5F968F001E6943F7AC11CFF9AE96B355.description: Identify employment areas in the local community where the target language is used and how and why the target language is necessary.

25E5C21719B246C8A6231D34DDACDDB2.description:
Use speaking, writing and reading to compare and connect local, national and global resources in English speaking communities with the target language resources in those communities.
  • Bookstores
  • Libraries
  • Newspapers and magazines
  • Radio and cable television
  • Internet and Website searches

D244E1A1AF0949FBA4A9D5F5E7B4C267.description: Identify comparisons and connections about resources in the local, national and global communities where the target language is used and resources where English is spoken or written in those same communities.

CF69B83E4D934CBC82F94FF36F7FF1CB.description:
Use target language skills to communicate interactively for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment in the global community.
  • Career exploration
  • Travel/study/work abroad
  • International cultural events and activities

7FD0AC0B3C3E4153A78AE3A9F0BC284E.description: Identify global resources for gathering information for practical purposes and personal enjoyment.

7A5CD63052164A74A9B116A4F5CF7CB8.description:
Use target language skills to communicate interactively for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment in the national community.
  • Career exploration
  • Ethnic celebrations
  • Entertainment (e.g., movies, plays, concerts, museums)

3CD803342879447A8B1CC89C8E65C295.description: Identify national resources for gathering information for practical purposes and personal enjoyment.

A796C7F40919459783C3639ED31B7EF2.description:
Use target language skills to communicate interactively for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment of the resources in the local community.
  • Career exploration
  • Local celebrations
  • Entertainment (e.g., movies, plays, concerts, museums)

9A87DE89D9A9415AA4EB3523389254BC.description: Identify local resources for gathering information for practical purposes and for personal enjoyment.

47072BB2B78D433FB924F06A74766FC3.description:
Use speaking, writing and reading to compare and connect the uses of English with the target language spoken in the local, national and global communities.
  • Schools and families
  • Offices and airports
  • Hospitals and police stations
  • Newspapers and magazines
  • Libraries and bookstores
  • Radio and television
  • Telephones and Internet

26D5CFE6209F4F59899E1CC062E2D8AD.description: Know simple comparisons and connections that can be made between the target language and English in the local, national and global communities.

41EF781956664033B1EBB4E6BE3D1F4D.description:
Introduce one's self, respond to simple questions and interpret simple messages on a global level.
  • Newspapers and magazines
  • Audio, video tapes
  • Radio
  • Key pals, pen pals, Internet
  • Television

1DF736C8CE414EEC975BDC7C0C1DDEE7.description: Know where the target language is spoken in the global community.

49644B927093486EA54A11376BED3FD4.description:
Respond to simple questions and interpret simple messages on a national level.
  • Newspapers and magazines
  • Audio and video tapes
  • Key pals, pen pals, Internet
  • Radio
  • Television

986EC4A42E6747BCB24A2726909A0954.description: Know where in the national community the target language and culture are experienced.

25E843E0F6E2428689CB9FF8AEF32580.description:
Introduce one's self and respond to simple questions in the local and regional community.
  • Face to face interaction
  • Key pals, pen pals, Internet
  • Audio and video tapes
  • Local celebrations
  • School club activities
  • Target language community visits where possible

B5B76FBA1BB04815B66BA91F44E49A0D.description: Know where in the local and regional community the target language and culture are useful.

883AE6AE58574BD0B625A4D1914306B2.description:
Read, discuss, write and make a presentation about Greco-Roman culture's traditions, customs and lifestyles that represent their perspectives, beliefs and assumptions.
  • Classical philosophy and religious traditions
  • Architecture
  • Love and marriage

6A549C670E154B36BF303C508C7CDB27.description: Analyze perspectives, beliefs and assumptions evident in Greco-Roman culture and literature.

B9C50EF8B12C4B81AC517AAD071182F7.description:
Synthesize topics and events from Greco-Roman culture relevant to other subject areas.
  • History (e.g., fall of the Roman Republic)
  • Humanities (e.g., classical mythology in modern art)
  • English (e.g., conventions of epic poetry)

F3D08255E4CE4F2EBDCF98E77DF128F0.description: Synthesize information about Greco-Roman culture for use in other subject areas.

D16BC54F15294D07BD8A9EAFA513C03A.description:
Speak, write and read about unfamiliar products, customs, institutions and historical events in the Greco-Roman cultures.
  • Classical geography and history
  • Techniques of classical literature and rhetoric

EED6729C980E42748775B4F248D26109.description: Analyze unfamiliar products, customs, institutions and historical events in Greco-Roman culture.

052508E71073477B8023BAD505F9FE40.description:
Read, interpret, discuss and write about cultural similarities and differences in Greco Roman culture and another culture.
  • Gender roles
  • Social status

5BEB178A934B4D2DB74CC79C41EADA45.description: Compare and contrast the similarities and differences between modern and Greco-Roman culture.

929918AC0FBD402697CA7F3644FA080A.description:
Research and select culturally competent information from multiple sources relevant to other subjects.
  • English (e.g., classical authors in translation)
  • Art (e.g., classical sculpture)

8AE6FE9F29DA4AD9B55EE324524099B8.description: Apply cultural information with details in other subject areas influenced by Greco-Roman culture.

B9875E90D96D406B81F274A529D72766.description:
Speak and write about a variety of historical events, products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.
  • Classical political systems
  • Historical periods and events
  • Classical literature

505E2F2ED9E9473E9D79A034FD249860.description: Explain a variety of historical events, products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.

74F64D7B924F45F882D1E8A9D83708AE.description:
Write about and dramatize cultural similarities and differences in daily activities in Roman or Greek culture.
  • Eating customs
  • Schooling
  • Sports and public entertainment
  • Occupations (e.g., army life)

CDE66A2CB3C54D6DBBB48F6755953AA5.description: Explain similarities and differences between modern and Greco-Roman culture.

D0346F58D9EE479CAF94A1A6D94E5B0C.description:
Read and comprehend simple sentences in classical Latin or Greek related to other school content areas.
  • Geography (e.g., travel)
  • Art (e.g., mythology)
  • Civics and Government (e.g., laws, justice)

E1CC26DD6D4446D4BEBA0F9E1FF18E81.description: Explain information with details in other subject areas influenced by Greco-Roman culture.

E037D467B91D4BC2A395A7AAEB52FDD3.description:
Discuss the main products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.
  • Classical authors
  • Classical city-state
  • Classical mythology

26502B712E8B42CE98605772F10C2B6E.description: Describe the products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.

35CEA9925E354B8DA98882F6B0A40AF4.description:
Model social interaction in the Roman or Greek culture and in one's own culture.
  • Family
  • Interaction among classes of people
  • Clothing

1610A49FFBCC43169632F99CE07E5627.description: Describe similarities and differences of daily life and social structures between modern and Greco-Roman culture.

6DF37657C8914F98BD950B85B390D317.description:
List and relate content subject words used in English that have origins in classical Latin or Greek.
  • Science (e.g., homo sapiens, medicine)
  • Literature (e.g., metaphor, simile)
  • Physical Education (e.g., Olympics, competition)
  • Civics and Government (e.g., democracy, president)

459A636457374D5784C2FBCF9E143542.description: Know basic information in school subject areas influenced by Greco-Roman culture.

EF1964E1699B4FE1913A11C031806BD6.description:
Discuss the fundamental products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.
  • Basic classical mythology
  • Famous people and cities
  • Roman marketplace

5CFF50EC44944D0D81241C39F926940F.description: Identify fundamental products and customs of Greco-Roman culture.

F0297C40EDC34C04AC26C94F689913B4.description: The Role of Culture in Classical World Language Acquisition

BF6A665FB91845B18B5A45A1004D1047.description:
Use the target language to synthesize topics and events from other subject areas.
  • Civics and Government (e.g., current political issues)
  • Humanities (e.g., art)
  • English (e.g., literature, history of language)
  • Environment & Ecology (e.g., national parks, global warming)
  • Economics (e.g., global economy)

910A63CCF0EB4FCB80027489E36917DC.description: Synthesize cultural information acquired in the target language for use in other subject areas.

298FE85037D942D2B02336ACD445F584.description:
Read, discuss, write and make a presentation about a culture's traditions, customs and lifestyles that represent its perspectives, beliefs and assumptions.
  • Peer and family relationships
  • Gender issues in the family and workplace
  • Institutional infrastructures (e.g., personnel, police, fire, health, government)

4271F3401433475DAC7B1AD22D840737.description: Analyze perspectives, beliefs and assumptions evident in the target culture and other cultures.

9340DB1E91734C038086C561C1474C9E.description:
Interpret, write about and dramatize cross-cultural situations occurring in the local community in order to explain varied cultural traditions and customs.
  • Daily personal business situations
  • Social situations
  • Home and family
  • Video representations (e.g., cartoons, short films, age appropriate videos)

D903D1AEA11C4D50B617EFDF28A47132.description: Analyze the misconceptions that occur in cross-cultural situations.

8C83B080A7034000A39403919B77B51E.description:
Speak, write and read about unfamiliar products, customs and institutions of the target culture.
  • System of government
  • Economic development
  • Educational system
  • Environmental concerns

22C19034374D4E1C8A47D39B36CC81D0.description: Analyze unfamiliar products, customs and institutions of the target culture.

C6EF2338943B4227A83A4E6B6263D791.description: Research and select culturally competent information from multiple sources for presentation (e.g., written, oral, visual in the target language).

51E0B31B77284EE8ACBB030B0AA4AC19.description: Apply cultural information from a variety of sources in the target language about a topic being studied in other school subjects.

18E57966F82748EAA24F30B93B2542FB.description:
Read, interpret, discuss and write about cultural similarities and differences in specific social interactions in two cultures.
  • Educational process (e.g., schedules, extra-curricular activities)
  • Personal healthcare and survival (e.g., going to doctor, hygiene)
  • Family (e.g., customs, traditions)

E1114625BEB344D3BF585E8CD7075F31.description: Compare and contrast the similarities and differences in social institutions between cultures.

039E0C989A684C11967F2DA706575656.description:
Generate spontaneous oral and written role-plays and interviews in a culturally competent manner.
  • Expressions of emotion
  • Conversations with speakers of the target culture
  • Negotiating everyday business routines (e.g., bank, service station)

1B29E0A0DC98474F8A10A48414CF393F.description: Assess cultural patterns in a variety of social settings.

26528502FAAE42F6BEC3D9C406A740EC.description:
Speak and write about cultural aspects of services, products and customs in the target language.
  • Cultural reenactments
  • Commerce and tourism
  • Popular culture

3481BE23ADC54AB1ABD01D145787CD62.description: Explain a variety of services, products and customs of the target culture.

46B53867FCCA454B89C48F602C2621C1.description:
Read and comprehend simple sentences from the target language/culture in other school content areas.
  • Consumer Science (e.g., recipe instructions and cooking terms)
  • Geography (e.g., map reading)
  • Mathematics (e.g., monetary systems and conversions)
  • Technology/Computer (e.g., instructions and frequently used terms)

E9CDCFDBE54740B4A95BD7F54E8F32A5.description: Know information with details in other subject areas influenced by the target culture.

9A0BD7D7AB084F4C89DAF6C41488D0C9.description:
Write about and dramatize cultural similarities and differences in daily activities in the target language.
  • Youth, school and leisure culture
  • Concept of personal space and distance
  • Relationships with adults and authority figures
  • Work ethic

FF92790A243348ECB067186D3AA13691.description: Explain similarities and differences of daily activities between cultures.

3ED84FE9862B4C68B14A918278FA0BA1.description:
Write and perform simple role-plays reflecting daily life in a culturally competent manner.
  • Making purchases and placing orders
  • Table manners and eating customs
  • Telephone and letter etiquette
  • School classes and activities

4C772C306D5040949ED7FBB398C3AB1A.description: Explain cultural patterns of daily social interaction.

F6F64AF041364FF181B1898D8D7C96A8.description:
Discuss the products and customs of the target culture in simple sentences in the target language.
  • Holidays
  • Famous people and their contributions
  • Menus and schedules

84D295FA54B046FB9A1F74A6098D3E6D.description: Describe the products and customs of the target culture.

AAD3F553D30C47D3B2994007CB894B22.description:
List and relate content subject words used in English that have origins in the target language.
  • Mathematics (e.g., metric, geometry)
  • Music (e.g., lento, a cappello, allegro)
  • Literature (e.g., Hansel and Gretel, Arabian Nights)
  • Physical Education (e.g., tango, ballet, Olympics, soccer)
  • Science (e.g., Fahrenheit, Celsius, Homo sapiens)

D220F941D825413D909A08124228D1A2.description: Know basic information in school subject areas influenced by the target culture (e.g., Fahrenheit, chocolate, patio).

021CC6C55A804BEEAED4F59CD3DEDAE8.description:
Model life skills and social interactions in the target language culture and in one's own culture.
  • Concepts of time and punctuality
  • Family and peer relationships
  • Daily routine
  • Knowledge of stereotypes
  • Cultural sensitivity

7D4DAFE49CB24F74A5B102D0D3B8BBFB.description: Describe similarities and differences of life skills and social structures in personal interactions between cultures.

B56D392146E744F68FC8439BB9254922.description:
Use culturally appropriate memorized expressions and gestures for basic social interactions.
  • Greetings and leave-takings
  • Familiar and polite forms of address
  • Common courtesies

61F7D8EF3D454EA9B42BF8B8D95F604D.description: Know typical expressions and gestures for basic social interactions in the target culture.

56D1043DB5864E0BAC625336E9BCF6BC.description:
Discuss the fundamental products and customs of the target culture in the target language.
  • Flags
  • Landmarks
  • Names
  • Culture-specific foods and crafts

2E00AE5ED6924BE1B0E5CA6DE07C42A7.description: Identify fundamental products and customs of the target culture.

96B81C4F643B42BC8B310CC4FA2C2549.description: The Role of Culture in World Language Acquisition

3B9488866BCE457094D5E3311FBED59B.description:
Demonstrate mastery of classical language skills by connecting influences of classical language or culture in another subject area.
  • Latin terms in psychology (e.g., ego, id, unconscious)
  • Ancient Greek political structure and modern democracy

4C5D38F7E4164A389B25A72246AF5BBC.description: Research, analyze and describe the classical languages' influence in different areas of the school curriculum.

141812587DC5457D81C5258A069B03C6.description:
Discuss a Greek or Roman event or cultural phenomenon that has influenced English.
  • "Achilles' heel"
  • Delphic Oracle, Sibyl
  • Socratic method

947ABC786FD8491298A964F62BC9C824.description: Describe the influence of historical events in classical culture that have an impact on the English language and culture.

40B69852E0B943EDACE7F9FC97D1545B.description:
Use simple, compound and complex sentence structures to comprehend advanced passages from ancient authors.
  • Conjugation of verbs in all tenses and moods
  • Main uses of moods other than the indicative mood
  • Advanced irregular verbs
  • Advanced case uses

4EE1A6EE11A34A3AB3E35BEBA31F8387.description: Know and analyze simple, compound and complex sentence structures in order to comprehend advanced passages from classical authors.

B8FD4AD1AE644913BCA2728F2792DF07.description:
Write and speak vocabulary used to construct connected sentences in Latin or Greek.
  • Abstract concepts
  • Politics

2FFFEB58148D4C0C992841F1967FBB22.description: Know enhanced vocabulary and idiomatic expressions used in written and oral communication.

A2245AB32949407285A7CF16A4A4515D.description:
Comprehend complex written sentences and paragraphs using enhanced vocabulary terms and verbs of using, enjoying, understanding from selected classical authors.
  • Philosophies
  • Historical events

5FF0E9594A694995B7F5378B1373D847.description: Recognize enhanced vocabulary used in complex reading selections from classical authors and listening.

EAC92DE17DB64FBD9EEAB96A72A937FC.description: Read prose and poetry aloud with attention to such features as metrical structure, meaningful phrase groupings, and appropriate voice inflections.

2E1BFBE90348473FB5462966226E4DD3.description: Know the basics of classical poetic meters and phrase patterns for reading aloud with appropriate voice inflections.

CCAB751172DE44C690EB642FCE2362DF.description:
Make a presentation or write a paragraph (in English) about another subject area explaining the connections
  • Terms in Roman and modern elections
  • Mythological references in an English poem
  • Latin roots of terms for insects or flowers

2896936CD60A4AC6AB6FE362B675591C.description: Analyze how the classical languages have influenced the school curriculum.

1D38162D78B244B0956908F51C4E9905.description:
Discuss families of words that are derived from Latin and Greek
  • Political terms (e.g., liberty, democracy, aristocracy)
  • Medical terms (e.g., stethoscope, leucocyte)

30BE2DAADCCA4AF0934597950E0DB377.description: Analyze and compare the origins and meanings of common Greek or Latin words used frequently in the English language.

127487A5895145C2B1FE278967B58E91.description:
Use simple, compound and complex sentence structures to comprehend reading passages from classical authors.
  • Participles
  • Passive voice
  • Reflexives
  • Pronouns and demonstratives
  • Common irregular verbs
  • Conjugation of verbs in all tenses

F85655FC6BFB4125BBCCB35FED33D2B3.description: Know simple, compound and complex sentence structures in order to comprehend reading passages from classical authors.

9AE166670FC4446091D80DF55DCD916E.description:
Write and speak vocabulary used to construct phrases and sentences in Latin or Greek.
  • Travel
  • Buildings
  • Geography
  • Government

40A4F7FD30AF42EDA4224A50F5037E84.description: Know advanced vocabulary and idiomatic expressions used in speaking and writing.

88DE8589AAFC43B0BA36B6EDD819ECD1.description:
Comprehend written sentences and paragraphs using vocabulary terms and verbs of wanting, thinking, believing, and liking from simple classical texts.
  • Traditions and customs
  • Military events (e.g., gladiator, chariot)

445ECC6C39CF45AD88FCD82BBFBF2B39.description: Recognize advanced vocabulary through reading selections from classical authors and listening.

E71785EAA98F4DCFB431CDE8C6777D0F.description: Speak and model phrases and sentences with refined pronunciation, rhythm and intonation with accuracy and understanding.

EAF5AD4012524174B5F7EDB808D76132.description: Know details of the sound system and spelling patterns of classical Latin or Greek.

1A122E59427E41B18FD650388210C6CA.description:
Model and represent the cross-curriculum connections in other subject areas for classmates and language teacher through classical Latin or Greek.
  • Greco Roman map of the Mediterranean world
  • Mythological roots of names for days of the week

96E746D5265F4A758CA102C3B4670B24.description: Explain how the classical languages have influenced other areas of the school curriculum.

7E8455F253DA45939239C6485732A445.description:
Use an English dictionary to find the meanings and origins of classical Latin or Greek words.
  • Common suffixes and prefixes (e.g., pro-, anti-, anthro-)
  • Legal terms (e.g., pro bono, habeas corpus)
  • Common phrases (e.g., sui generis, quid pro quo)

12AC897FCA534B479933A4A98BC8A147.description: Identify words in English that have origins in the classical languages.

56DD83F41D2140ACBFAFC60AE2E3CB67.description:
Use simple sentence and question structures in order to comprehend dialogs and short paragraphs
